TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1227-1228
TEI.2.document_title: James Cummins to Stephen F. Austin, 10-22-1825

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1227-1228

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Land business.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dear sir*/p*
*p*Enclosed I send you the articals of agreement between *person_mentioned*John Roe*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*John Tumlinson*/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Roe*/person_mentioned* says that he has papers from the *person_mentioned*governor*/person_mentioned* of this State to [hold] his land for his servises on any unapropriated Lands in this province, he says he will lay all his papers before you and I want you to deside on the Case we must have the Land Called for in the artical or what we have paid for it or the Value thereof. Though you will decide as you think proper when you see all the papers—but I do not believe he has one dollar to pay back for what he has recd—yours Respectfully */p* *p**person_mentioned*Jas Cummins*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="10-22-1825">Oct. 22,1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
